alert.note: Alert for Adair; Adams; Appanoose; Cass; Clarke; Davis; Decatur; Lucas; Madison; Mahaska; Marion; Monroe; Poweshiek; Ringgold; Taylor; Union; Wapello; Warren; Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 16 at 11:19AM CST until February 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Snow Continues Into This Afternoon... .Snow will continue to move across southwest into east central Iowa tapering off late afternoon into early evening. The peak snowfall rates around or greater than an inch per hour will persist until midday to early afternoon through central into eastern Iowa. Breezy winds from the north will continue to cause blowing snow along with the accumulating snow dropping visibilities to under a mile at times into mid afternoon. Give yourself plenty of space between vehicles and extra time to reach your destination if out on the roads this afternoon. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. Breezy winds from the north are likely to produce areas of blowing and drifting snow, especially in rural areas. * WHERE...Much of southern Iowa. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel is likely to be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest snowfall rates are expected through midday right across the I-35 corridor in central to southern Iowa. Be prepared for slick roads and poor visibility and allow extra time to reach your destination.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep a blanket, extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
